alert.note: Alert for Boulder And Jefferson Counties Below 6000 Feet, West Broomfield County; Central and South Weld County; Elbert, Central and East Douglas Counties Above 6000 Feet; Jefferson and West Douglas Counties Above 6000 Feet, Gilpin, Clear Creek, Northeast Park Counties Below 9000 Feet; Larimer County Below 6000 Feet, Northwest Weld County; North Douglas County Below 6000 Feet, Denver, West Adams and Arapahoe Counties, East Broomfield County (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued April 04 at 6:20AM MDT until April 04 at 9:00AM MDT by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...SLICK TRAVEL FOR THE TUESDAY MORNING COMMUTE... .Bands of moderate to heavy snow have spread across the I-25 corridor this morning, with slick travel conditions in spots. Snow will also continue across the northern mountains today with snow and blowing snow likely. ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 AM MDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Snow ongoing. Additional snow accumulations up to two inches. Winds gusting as high as 35 mph. * WHERE...Portions of central, north central, and northeast Colorado, including the I-25 corridor, Southern Foothills and Palmer Divide, and Greeley. * WHEN...Until 9 AM MDT this morning. * IMPACTS...Roads will likely become slick and hazardous, especially on bridges and overpasses. Use caution when traveling. The hazardous conditions could impact the Tuesday morning commute.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions for Colorado can be obtained by calling 5 1 1 or by going to www.cotrip.org. Roads will be slick resulting in slow and hazardous travel. Allow extra time to reach your destination.
